algorithms

Class BFS<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.BFS<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - type of the vertices of the graph to search

    public class BFS<V>
extends java.lang.Object
    Breadth-First Search algorithm

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BFS(AbstractGraph<V,?> graph, V source)
      Traverses all the graph starting from source vertex
      BFS(AbstractGraph<V,?> graph, V source, V to_find)
      Find the shortest path from a source vertex to another vertex.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.HashMap<V,java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger> getDistances()
      Get map containing the shortest distance from the source vertex to each vertex.
      java.util.HashMap<V,V> getPredecessors()
      Get map containing the predecessor of each vertex in the shortest path to the source vertex.
      java.util.HashSet<V> getVisited()
      Get set of the visited vertices

    • Constructor Detail

      • BFS

        public BFS(AbstractGraph<V,?> graph,
   V source)
        Traverses all the graph starting from source vertex
        Parameters:
        graph - graph to traverse
        source - vertex to start from

      • BFS

        public BFS(AbstractGraph<V,?> graph,
   V source,
   V to_find)
        Find the shortest path from a source vertex to another vertex. This version doesn't traverse all the graph. It stops when the vertex to find is found.
        Parameters:
        graph - graph
        source - vertex to start from
        to_find - vertex to find

    • Method Detail

      • getDistances

        public java.util.HashMap<V,java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger> getDistances()
        Get map containing the shortest distance from the source vertex to each vertex.
        Returns:
        HashMap of the vertices as keys and the distances as values

      • getPredecessors

        public java.util.HashMap<V,V> getPredecessors()
        Get map containing the predecessor of each vertex in the shortest path to the source vertex. If the predecessor is null, there is no path or the graph wasn't fully traversed.
        Returns:
        HashMap of the vertices as keys and their predecessors as values

      • getVisited

        public java.util.HashSet<V> getVisited()
        Get set of the visited vertices
        Returns:
        HashSet of the visited vertices
